full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 465 Filed 11/15/21 Page 3 of 127
LB1 TMAX1

1 Counsel, I'm prepared to turn to the motions first,
2 unless there's any reason to deviate from that.
3 Ms. Moe?
4 MS. MOE: No, your Honor, thank you.
5 THE COURT: Ms. Sternheim?
6 MS. STERNHEIM: Not at this time, Judge.
7
8 THE COURT: All right. I am in receipt of the
9 parties' various motions in limine, responses in opposition,
10 and replies in support. I did require the parties to file the
11 papers on the public docket with their proposed redactions so
12 that the public could have immediate access to the documents.
13 I'll rule on the proposed redactions as quickly as I can,
14 including some that I will discuss today, but we will use
15 the same process going forward so as not to delay public access
16 to the bulk of materials related to pretrial filings. And I
17 thank counsel for that, as well as the submission to me of the
18 unredacted versions with the color coding indicating requested
19 redactions.
20 The government filed 11 motions in limine and the
21 defense 13, so there's a lot of ground to cover. I am prepared
22 to discuss all the motions now with the exception of the
23 Daubert motion. As I indicated in an order that was docketed
24 this morning, I will hold a Daubert hearing before resolving
25 that motion.
26 As to the rest, some I want to hear further from the

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00007054

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear and legible format. There are no visible redactions or damage to the document.
